summary:
The Western Roman Empire was the western part of the Roman Empire, ruled separately from the east. This division started around AD 395 and lasted until 476 when the Western Empire fell. After this, the Eastern Roman Empire, also known as the Byzantine Empire, became the sole ruler.

In the 6th century, the Byzantine Emperor Justinian I regained control of some western territories, but they were eventually lost. The Western Empire's influence decreased, marked by Charlemagne's coronation as Emperor in 800, creating a new imperial line.
title: Western Roman Empire
